metadata.title: Display Shutdown Button
metadata.description: Preventing display of the shutdown button in the logon dialog box may encourage a hard shut down with the power button. The Shutdown button will be displayed per the FDCC. (Howevery, displaying the shutdown button may allow individuals to shut down a system anonymously.)

criteria.comment: Allow the system to be shutdown without logging on

criterion.comment: Ensure registry key ShutdownWithoutLogon is configured correctly
Ensure registry key ShutdownWithoutLogon is configured correctly

metadata.title: Legal Notice (Warning Banner)
metadata.description: Determines if the Legal Notice is configured using the required text.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice is configured with the required text.
Legal Notice is configured with the required text.

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time that must pass between two successive login attempts to ensure that a lockout will occur. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.

criteria.comment: Ensure Lockout counter is greater than or equal to 60 minutes or 3600 seconds

criterion.comment: Ensure lockout counter is greater than or equal to 60 minutes
checks account lockout threshold policy setting is not equal to 0

metadata.title: Account Lockout Duration
metadata.description: Determines compliance with requirement that locked out accounts require administrator unlock and are not unlocked after a defined lockout duration.

criterion.comment: Tests if account lockout duration is forever,option1
checks account lockout threshold policy setting is not equal to 0

metadata.title: Maximum Password Age
metadata.description: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Further, scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.

criteria.comment: Maximum Password Age not equal to -1 and greater than 60 days

criterion.comment: Max Password Age does not have a never expires value
Maximum Password Age is less than or equal to 60 days or 5184000 seconds

metadata.title: Password Uniqueness
metadata.description: Password Uniqueness is not set properly

metadata.title: Disable Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies built-in guest account is disabled
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
metadata.description: This policy setting configures the local system to verify that newly-created passwords conform to the more stricter policy.

criteria.comment: Ensure built-in password filter is enabled

criterion.comment: Ensure built in password filter is enabled

metadata.title: UR: Deny access to this computer from the network
metadata.description: The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local administrator accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

extend_definition.comment: Deny access to this computer from the network - Non-Domain Systems
Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Joined Systems

metadata.title: Reversible Password Encryption
metadata.description: Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords. For this reason, this policy should never be enabled.

criteria.comment: Ensure reversible password encryption is DISABLED

criterion.comment: Ensure reversible password encryption is DISABLED

metadata.title: Named Pipes Accessed Anonymously
metadata.description: Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously' is configured to contain no values
Verifies 'Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously' contains no values other than NETLOGON, SAMR, Browser or LSARPC

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths
metadata.description: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths

criterion.comment: Registry key AllowedExactPaths is blank
Registry key AllowedExactPaths only has specific values
Registry key AllowedExactPaths does not exist

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Network Shares
metadata.description: This is a Category 1 finding because the potential for gaining unauthorized system access. Any shares listed can be accessed by any network user. This could lead to the exposure or corruption of sensitive data. Enabling this setting is very dangerous.

criteria.comment: Ensure that the value for the NullSessionShares registry key is blank

criterion.comment: NullSessionShares registry value does not exist
NullSessionShares registry is blank

metadata.title: Safe DLL Search Mode
metadata.description: The default search behavior, when an application calls a function in a Dynamic Link Library (DLL), is to search the current directory followed by the directories contained in the systems path environment variable. An unauthorized DLL inserted into an applications working directory could allow malicious code to be run on the system. Creating the following registry key and setting the appropriate value forces the system to search the %Systemroot% for the DLL before searching the current directory or the rest of the path.

criterion.comment: Default comment, please change
Default comment, please change
Audit Log Warning Level
TCP Connection Keep-Alive Time

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths and Sub-Paths
metadata.description: Determines if unauthorized registry paths and sub-paths are remotely accessible

criterion.comment: Registry key AllowedPaths is blank
Registry key AllowedPaths has specific values
Registry key AllowedPaths does not exist

metadata.title: Auditing Configuration
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detect an attack that has begun or is about to begin. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Without an audit trail that provides information as to event that occurred and if it was successful or unsuccessful, it is difficult to analyze a series of events to determine the steps used by an attacker to compromise a system or network, or what exactly happened that led to a denial of service. Collecting data such as the successful and unsuccessful events is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

criterion.comment: Ensure correct auditing configuration for Security System Extension (System Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for System Integrity (System Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for IPSec Driver (System Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Security State Change (System Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Logon (Logon/Logoff Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Logoff (Logon/Logoff Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Special Logon (Logon/Logoff Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for File System (Object Access Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Registry (Object Access Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Sensitive Privilege Use (Privilege Use Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Process Creation (Detailed Tracking Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Audit Policy Change (Policy Change Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Authentication Policy Change (Policy Change Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for User Account Management (Account Management Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Computer Account Management (Account Management Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Security Group Management (Account Management Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Other Account Management Events (Account Management Audit)
Ensure correct auditing configuration for Credential Validation (Account Logon Audit)

metadata.title: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode

criterion.comment: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
IPv6 Transition
IPv6 Transition
Order Prints Online

metadata.title: Built-in Admin Account Status
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies the built-in administrator account is disabled

metadata.title: The current, approved service pack is not installed.
metadata.description: System is at a supported service pack. All prior to SP2 are a finding.

criterion.comment: Test for SP2

metadata.title: File Auditing Configuration
metadata.description: Improper modification of the core system files can render a system inoperable. Further, modifications to these system files can have a significant impact on the security configuration of the system. Auditing of significant modifications made to the system files provides a method of determining the responsible party.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives>Automated checking sometimes reports this as a false finding. If a manual review of a questionable finding shows auditing to be set correctly, then this would not be a finding.

criterion.comment: Volumes use NTFS
Audit Object Access Failure
Audit Object Access Failure and Success

criteria.comment: Local volumes audit permissions are set correctly.

criterion.comment: standard_delete: AUDIT_FAILURE
standard_delete: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
standard_read_control: AUDIT_FAILURE
standard_read_control: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
standard_write_dac: AUDIT_FAILURE
standard_write_dac: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
standard_write_owner: AUDIT_FAILURE
standard_write_owner: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_read_data: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_read_data: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_write_data: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_write_data: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_append_data: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_append_data: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_read_ea: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_read_ea: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_write_ea: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_write_ea: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_execute: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_execute: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_delete_child: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_delete_child: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_delete_child: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_delete_child: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE
file_write_attributes: AUDIT_FAILURE
file_write_attributes: AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE

metadata.title: NTFS Requirement
metadata.description: Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.

criterion.comment: Volumes use NTFS

metadata.title: Clear System Pagefile
metadata.description: System pagefile is cleared upon shutdown.

metadata.title: Removable media devices - Floppies
metadata.description: Floppy media devices are not allocated upon user logon.

metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials
metadata.description: Caching of logon credentials is not limited.

criterion.comment: System is not a member of a domain

metadata.title: Bad Logon Attempts
metadata.description: Number of allowed bad-logon attempts does not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: User Right - Act as part of OS
metadata.description: Unauthorized users are granted right to Act as part of the operating system.

metadata.title: User Rights Assignments
metadata.description: User rights and advanced user rights settings do not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: Minimum password age does not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies built-in guest account has been renamed
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Administrator Account
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies built-in administrator account has been renamed

metadata.title: Event Log Sizes
metadata.description: Event log sizes do not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Users are not forcibly disconnected when logon hours expire.

metadata.title: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server.
metadata.description: Unencrypted password is sent to 3rd party SMB Server.

metadata.title: Local Users on a Workstation in a Domain
metadata.description: Determines if domain members have any local users (besides built-ins [admin, guest], help, and support).

criterion.comment: System is not a member of a domain
System has no local users (besides local admin, guest, help, and support)

metadata.title: Secure Print Driver Installation
metadata.description: Print driver installation privilege is not restricted to administrators.

metadata.title: LanMan Authentication Level
metadata.description: The Send download LanMan compatible password option is not set to Send NTLMv2 response only\refuse LM.

metadata.title: Ctrl+Alt+Del Security Attention Sequence
metadata.description: Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence is Disabled.

metadata.title: Smart Card Removal Option
metadata.description: The Smart Card removal option is set to take no action.

metadata.title: Recovery Console - SET Command
metadata.description: The Recovery Console SET command is enabled.

metadata.title: Recovery Console - Automatic Logon
metadata.description: The Recovery Console option is set to permit automatic logon to the system.

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (if client agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Encryption of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not encrypted when possible.

metadata.title: Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not signed when possible.

metadata.title: Computer Account Password Reset
metadata.description: The computer account password is prevented from being reset.

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (if server agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Format and Eject Removable Media
metadata.description: Ejection of removable NTFS media is not restricted to Administrators.

metadata.title: Password Expiration Warning
metadata.description: Users are not warned in advance that their passwords will expire.

metadata.title: Global System Objects Permission Strength
metadata.description: The default permissions of Global system objects are not increased.

metadata.title: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.
metadata.description: Amount of idle time required before suspending a session is improperly set.

metadata.title: Disable Media Autoplay
metadata.description: The system is configured to autoplay removable media.

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: The use of local accounts with blank passwords is not restricted to console logons only.

metadata.title: Windows Messenger - Do Not Allow To Run
metadata.description: The user is allowed to launch Windows Messenger (MSN Messenger, .NET Messenger).

metadata.title: Windows Messenger - Do Not Start Automatically
metadata.description: Windows Messenger (MSN Messenger, .NET messenger) is run at system startup.

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: The maximum age for machine account passwords is not set to requirements.

metadata.title: Strong Session Key
metadata.description: The system is not configured to require a strong session key.

metadata.title: Domain Controller authentication for unlock
metadata.description: Domain Controller authentication is not required to unlock the workstation.

metadata.title: Storage of Passwords and Credentials
metadata.description: The system is configured to permit storage of credentials or .NET Passports.

metadata.title: Everyone Permissions Apply to Anonymous
metadata.description: The system is configured to give anonymous users Everyone rights.

metadata.title: Sharing and Security Model for Local Accounts
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use the Classic security model.

metadata.title: LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
metadata.description: The system is configured to store the LAN Manager hash of the password in the SAM.

metadata.title: Force Logoff When Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire is set to Enabled

metadata.title: LDAP Client Signing
metadata.description: The system is not configured to recommended LDAP client signing requirements.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Clients.

metadata.title: FIPS Compliant Algorithms
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use FIPS compliant Algorithms for Encryption, Hashing, and Signing.

metadata.title: Case Insensitivity for Non-Windows
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow case insensitivity.

metadata.title: NetMeeting Disable Remote Desktop Sharing
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow remote desktop sharing through NetMeeting.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Password Prompting
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Set Encryption Level
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Do Not Use Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is configured to use a common temporary folder for all sessions.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Delete Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to delete temporary folders.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Disc. Session
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to set a time limit for disconnected sessions.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Idle Session
metadata.description: Terminal Services is configured to allow an Idle session limit does not meet the requirement.

metadata.title: Remote Assistance - Offer Remote Assistance
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow unsolicited remote assistance offers.

metadata.title: Media Player - Disable Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Media Player is configured to allow automatic checking for updates.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP based Servers
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Servers.

metadata.title: Disable IP Source Routing
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow IP source routing.

metadata.title: Disable ICMP Redirect
metadata.description: The system is configured to redirect ICMP.

metadata.title: Disable Router Discovery
metadata.description: The system is configured to detect and configure default gateway addresses.

metadata.title: Name-Release Attacks
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow name-release attacks.

metadata.title: TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: TCP data retransmissions are not controlled.

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period
metadata.description: This check verifies that Windows is configured to have password protection take effect within a limited time frame when the screen saver becomes active.

metadata.title: Group Policy - Registry Policy Processing
metadata.description: Group Policy objects are not reprocessed if they have not changed.

metadata.title: DCOM - Object Registry Permission
metadata.description: A Windows system has a writable DCOM configuration.

metadata.title: Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not encrypted or signed.

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows Server SMB client is not enabled to always perform SMB packet signing.

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows Server SMB server is not enabled to always perform SMB packet signing.

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Named Pipes and Shares can be accessed anonymously.

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: For systems utilizing a logon ID as the individual identifier, passwords are not at a minimum of 14-characters.

metadata.title: Display of Last User Name
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow the display of the last user name on the logon screen.

metadata.title: Audit Access to Global System Objects
metadata.description: Audit Access to Global System Objects is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Backup and Restore Privileges
metadata.description: Audit of Backup and Restore Privileges is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Policy Subcategory Setting
metadata.description: Audit policy using subcategories is enabled.

metadata.title: Hide Computer

metadata.title: WINCC-000081
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Default Protections for Popular Software must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Default Protections for Popular Software' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000082
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be enabled and configured to at least Application Opt Out.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System DEP' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt Out' selected
Verifies 'System DEP' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Always On' selected

metadata.title: EMET system-wide SEHOP must be enabled
metadata.description: EMET system-wide SEHOP must be enabled

criterion.comment: EMET system-wide SEHOP must be enabled

metadata.title: Local admin accounts filtered token policy enabled on domain systems.
metadata.description: Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.

criterion.comment: Test for non domain system
Local admin accounts filtered token policy enabled on domain systems.

metadata.title: UR: Deny access to this computer from the network - Non-Domain Systems
metadata.description: The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local administrator accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

criterion.comment: System is not a member of a domain
Deny access to this computer from the network - Guests

metadata.title: UR: Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Systems
metadata.description: The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local administrator accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

All Local Administrators are included in the DeniedNetworkAccess Group

metadata.description: A group must be defined on domain systems to include all local administrator accounts.

metadata.description: The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges must be disabled.

metadata.title: WINER-000006
metadata.description: Displaying error messages to users provides them the option of sending the reports. Error reports should be sent silently, unknown to the user. This setting controls whether users are shown an error dialog box that lets them report an error.

criterion.comment: DontShowUI enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000010
metadata.description: The error reporting archive is stored locally on the system, and is created after an error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined). This creates a backup of the error reporting.

criterion.comment: DisableArchive enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000011
metadata.description: The error reporting archive is stored locally on the system and is created after an error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined). Storing all data, including memory contents, adds data that is very helpful in analyzing the errors.

criterion.comment: configurearchive enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000012
metadata.description: The retention of archived reports provides a history. Older reports are automatically deleted as new reports are generated once the maximum limit has been met. The archive is stored locally on the system and is created after the error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).

criterion.comment: MaxArchiveCount 100 or greater

metadata.title: WINER-000013
metadata.description: Queueing error reports provides the ability for a system to collect reports locally or until a collection server can be contacted. Valuable system diagnostic and vulnerability information may be lost if the report queue is disabled.

criterion.comment: DisableQueue enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000014
metadata.description: Error reports are queued for sending to an error reporting site when the queueing behavior is set to Always Queue. This will maintain the reports in the queue until a connection can be made to the collection server.

criterion.comment: ForceQueue enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000015
metadata.description: The error reporting queue is stored locally on the system and contains the error reports until they have been manually removed or automatically sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined). Once a report has been sent to a collector, it is moved to the report archive. Old reports are deleted as new ones arrive once the maximum limit has been met.

criterion.comment: MaxQueueCount 50 or greater

metadata.title: WINER-000016
metadata.description: Error reports stored in the queue should be forwarded to a local or DOD-wide collection site when the system can connect to the site. This setting controls the frequency a system will use to try forwarding queued reports to the local or DOD-wide collector.

criterion.comment: QueuePesterInterval enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000017
metadata.description: Configuring error reporting to send all requested data ensures all relevant data associated with the error report is captured for later analysis. This setting determines the default consent behavior of Windows Error Reporting.

criterion.comment: DefaultConsent enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000018
metadata.description: This setting determines the behavior of the "Configure Default Consent" setting in relation to custom consent settings. Enabling this allows the default consent levels of Windows Error Reporting to always override any other consent policy setting.

criterion.comment: DefaultOverrideBehavior enabled

metadata.title: The Windows Error Reporting Service must be running and configured to start automatically.
metadata.description: Windows Error Reporting information can be used to help diagnose day-to-day software issues, as well as help discover malicious code and possibly zero-day attacks on systems.

criterion.comment: verifies WER service is running
verifies WER start type is auto
